intro: Boucerosia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The genus comprises several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials with attractive, showy flowers. Boucerosia plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, yellow or white flowers that bloom in spring. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
